item.title: I was a Financial Criminal on Habbo as a Child
item.description: “Think… Think of something that is important to you…” The bird chirped on the sill of the window. “Of how the colors blend, of the smell of packed mortadella sandwich lunches, yoghurt and gouache. Of kindergarten and sunny days. Of how happy and full your heart was. Of…” And then it flew away, mid-sentence, not letting my imagination catch up to what the chirps and birdsongs could’ve meant. I can’t really think of anything significant.
